cast

public static final <T,E extends java.lang.RuntimeException> T cast(java.lang.Object obj,
                                                                    java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                                    java.lang.String info,
                                                                    java.lang.Class<E> throwable)
                    throws E extends java.lang.RuntimeException
Tests to see if the object can be cast to the specified type. Will not test to see arguments are not null.

Type Parameters:
T - the type
E - the thrown exception type
Parameters:
obj - the object to be cast
clazz - of the the target type
info - the message for the exception thrown
throwable - specified if not
Returns:
the cast object if successful
Throws:
E
E extends java.lang.RuntimeException

throwIt

private static final <E extends java.lang.RuntimeException> void throwIt(java.lang.String msg,
                                                                         java.lang.Class<E> clazz)
                           throws E extends java.lang.RuntimeException
Not really intended for external use since you could simply throw new E (msg).

Usage (if you must): 


 // ... somewhere within the bowels of your code ..
 //
 Assert.throwIt ("why am i calling Assert.throwIt() when I could be throwing myself?", YourRuntimeException.class);

Type Parameters:
E - RuntimeException subclass to to throw
Parameters:
msg - message to set in the exception
clazz - the Class of E
Throws:
E - your requested exception (unless reflection instantiate failed, in which case it will be a plain old RuntimeException)
E extends java.lang.RuntimeException
